022import static java.lang.Character.isISOControl;
023import static java.lang.Thread.currentThread;
024import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toMap;
025import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.DEPRECATED;
026import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;

031import javax.lang.model.element.Modifier;
032import java.util.ArrayList;

054/**
055 *  Several utility functions to be used with JavaComposer.
056 *
057 *  @author Square,Inc.
058 *  @modified Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
059 *  @version $Id: Util.java 920 2021-05-23 14:27:24Z tquadrat $
060 *  @since 0.0.5
061 *
062 *  @UMLGraph.link
063 */
064@UtilityClass
065@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Util.java 920 2021-05-23 14:27:24Z tquadrat $" )
066public final class Util
067{
068        /*-----------*\
069    ====** Constants **========================================================
070        \*-----------*/
071    /**
072     *  The place holder for {@code null} references.
073     */
074    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
075    public static final Object NULL_REFERENCE = new Object();
076
077    /**
078     *  The return value of
079     *  {@link #createDebugOutput(boolean)}
080     *  when no debug output is desired.
081     */
082    @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType" )
083    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
084    public static final Optional<DebugOutput> NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT = Optional.empty();
085
086        /*--------------*\
087    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
088        \*--------------*/
089    /**
090     *  No instance allowed for this class.
091     */
092    private Util() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( Util.class ); }
093
094        /*---------*\
095    ====** Methods **==========================================================
096        \*---------*/
097    /**
098     *  Translates the given character into a String; when that character is a
099     *  special character, it will be escaped properly so that it can be used
100     *  in a Java String literal.
101     *
102     *  @param  c   The input character.
103     *  @return The target String.
104     *
105     *  @see <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se10/html/jls-3.html#jls-3.10.6">The Java Language Specification: 3.10.6. Escape Sequences for Character and String Literals </a>
106     */
107    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
108    public static final String characterLiteralWithoutSingleQuotes( final char c )
109    {
110        final var retValue = switch( c )
111        {
112            case '\b' -> "\\b"; // u0008: backspace (BS)
113            case '\t' -> "\\t"; // u0009: horizontal tab (HT)
114            case '\n' -> "\\n"; // u000a: linefeed (LF)
115            case '\f' -> "\\f"; // u000c: form feed (FF)
116            case '\r' -> "\\r"; // u000d: carriage return (CR)
117            case '"' -> Character.toString( c ); // u0022: double quote (")
118            case '\'' -> "\\'"; // u0027: single quote (')
119            case '\\' -> "\\\\"; // u005c: backslash (\)
120            default -> isISOControl( c ) ? format( "\\u%04x", (int) c ) : Character.toString( c );
121        };
122
123        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
124        return retValue;
125    }   //  characterLiteralWithoutSingleQuotes()
126
127    /**
128     *  Checks the given {@code condition} and throws a
129     *  {@link ValidationException}
130     *  if it is {@code false}.
131     *
132     *  @param  condition   The condition to check.
133     *  @param  format  The message format for the exception message.
134     *  @param  args    The arguments for the exception message.
135     *  @throws ValidationException The condition was not met.
136     *
137     *  @deprecated Use
138     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#checkState(boolean, Supplier)},
139     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Function, Predicate)},
140     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Supplier, Predicate)},
141     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, String, Predicate)},
142     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Predicate)},
143     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidArgument(Object, String, Predicate)}
144     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidArgument(Object, String, Predicate, java.util.function.UnaryOperator)},
145     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidNonNullArgument(Object, String, Predicate)}
146     *      or
147     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidNonNullArgument(Object, String, Predicate, java.util.function.UnaryOperator)}
148     *      instead.
149     */
150    @SuppressWarnings( "DeprecatedIsStillUsed" )
151    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
152    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
153    public static final void checkArgument( final boolean condition, final String format, final Object... args ) throws ValidationException
154    {
155        if( !condition ) throw new ValidationException( format( format, args ) );
156    }   //  checkArgument()
157
158    /**
159     *  Checks the given {@code condition} and throws a
160     *  {@link IllegalStateException}
161     *  if it is {@code false}.
162     *
163     *  @param  condition   The condition to check.
164     *  @param  format  The message format for the exception message.
165     *  @param  args    The arguments for the exception message.
166     *  @throws IllegalStateException The condition was not met.
167     *
168     *  @deprecated Use
169     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#checkState(boolean, Supplier)},
170     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Function, Predicate)},
171     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Supplier, Predicate)},
172     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, String, Predicate)},
173     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Predicate)},
174     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidArgument(Object, String, Predicate)}
175     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidArgument(Object, String, Predicate, java.util.function.UnaryOperator)},
176     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidNonNullArgument(Object, String, Predicate)}
177     *      or
178     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidNonNullArgument(Object, String, Predicate, java.util.function.UnaryOperator)}
179     *      instead.
180     */
181    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
182    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
183    public static final void checkState( final boolean condition, final String format, final Object... args )
184    {
185        if( !condition ) throw new IllegalStateException( format( format, args ) );
186    }   //  checkState()
187
188    /**
189     *  Creates the debug output.
190     *
191     *  @param  addDebugOutput  {@code true} if some debug output should be
192     *      added to the generated code, {@code false} otherwise.
193     *  @param  fromBuilder {@code true} if the call was made from a builder,
194     *      {@code false} otherwise.
195     *  @return An instance of
196     *      {@link Optional}
197     *      that holds the debug output; empty if the parameter
198     *      {@code addDebugOutput} is {@code false}.
199     *
200     *  @see #NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT
201     *
202     *  @deprecated Replaced by
203     *      {@link #createDebugOutput(boolean)}
204     *      because of a reworked debug output pattern.
205     */
206    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
207    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanParameter" )
208    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
209    public static final Optional<DebugOutput> createDebugOutput( final boolean addDebugOutput, final boolean fromBuilder )
210    {
211        //---* Get the caller's caller *---------------------------------------
212        final var depth = fromBuilder ? 4 : 3;
213        final var retValue = addDebugOutput ? Optional.of( new DebugOutput( JavaUtils.findCaller( depth ) ) ) : NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT;
214
215        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
216        return retValue;
217    }   //  createDebugOutput()
218
219    /**
220     *  Creates the debug output.
221     *
222     *  @param  addDebugOutput  {@code true} if some debug output should be
223     *      added to the generated code, {@code false} otherwise.
224     *  @return An instance of
225     *      {@link Optional}
226     *      that holds the debug output; empty if the parameter
227     *      {@code addDebugOutput} is {@code false}.
228     *
229     *  @see #NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT
230     */
231    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
232    public static final Optional<DebugOutput> createDebugOutput( final boolean addDebugOutput )
233    {
234        //---* Get the caller's caller *---------------------------------------
235        final var retValue = addDebugOutput ? Optional.of( new DebugOutput( findCaller() ) ) : NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT;
236
237        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
238        return retValue;
239    }   //  createDebugOutput()
240
241    /**
242     *  <p>{@summary This method will find the method that makes the call into
243     *  the Java Composer API and returns the appropriate stack trace
244     *  element.}</p>
245     *  <p>The respective method is determined by the package name of the
246     *  containing class: it does <i>not</i> start with
247     *  {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer}.</p>
248     *
249     *  @return An instance of
250     *      {@link Optional}
251     *      that holds the stack trace element for the caller; will be empty if
252     *      the call was internal.
253     */
254    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.2.0" )
255    private static final Optional<StackTraceElement> findCaller()
256    {
257        //---* Retrieve the stack *--------------------------------------------
258        final var stackTraceElements = currentThread().getStackTrace();
259        final var len = stackTraceElements.length;
260
261        //---* Search the stack *----------------------------------------------
262        Optional<StackTraceElement> retValue = Optional.empty();
263        FindLoop: for( var i = 1; i < len; ++i )
264        {
265            final var className = stackTraceElements [i].getClassName();
266            if( !className.startsWith( "org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer" ) )
267            {
268                retValue = Optional.of( stackTraceElements [i] );
269                break FindLoop;
270            }
271        }   //  FindLoop:
272
273        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
274        return retValue;
275    }   //  findCaller()
276
277    /**
278     *  Creates an immutable list from the given collection.
279     *
280     *  @param  <T> The type of the list elements.
281     *  @param  collection  The collection.
282     *  @return The immutable list.
283     *
284     *  @deprecated Use
285     *      {@link List#copyOf(Collection)}
286     *      instead.
287     */
288    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
289    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
290    public static final <T> List<T> immutableList( final Collection<T> collection )
291    {
292        final var retValue = List.copyOf( requireNonNullArgument( collection, "collection" ) );
293
294        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
295        return retValue;
296    }   //  immutableList()
297
298    /**
299     *  Creates an immutable map from the given map.
300     *
301     *  @param  <K> The type of the map's keys.
302     *  @param  <V> The type of the map's values.
303     *  @param  map The map.
304     *  @return The immutable copy of the input map.
305     *
306     *  @deprecated Use
307     *      {@link Map#copyOf(Map)}
308     *      instead.
309     */
310    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
311    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
312    public static final <K,V> Map<K,V> immutableMap( final Map<K,V> map )
313    {
314        final var retValue = Map.copyOf( requireNonNullArgument( map, "map" ) );
315
316        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
317        return retValue;
318    }   //  immutableMap()
319
320    /**
321     *  Creates an immutable multi map from the given multi map.
322     *
323     *  @param  <K> The type of the map's keys.
324     *  @param  <V> The type of the map's values.
325     *  @param  multiMap    The multi map.
326     *  @return The immutable copy of the input multi map.
327     *
328     *  @deprecated No replacement!
329     */
330    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
331    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
332    public static final <K,V> Map<K,List<V>> immutableMultimap( final Map<? extends K, ? extends List<V>> multiMap )
333    {
334        final BinaryOperator<List<V>> merger = (v1,v2) ->
335        {
336            final Collection<V> l = new ArrayList<>( v1.size() + v2.size() );
337            l.addAll( v1 );
338            l.addAll( v2 );
339            return List.copyOf( l );
340        };
341
342        final Map<K,List<V>> buffer = requireNonNullArgument( multiMap, "multiMap" ).entrySet().stream()
343            .filter( e -> nonNull( e.getValue() ) && !e.getValue().isEmpty() )
344            .collect( toMap( Entry::getKey, e -> List.copyOf( e.getValue() ), merger, LinkedHashMap::new  ) );
345        final var retValue = Map.copyOf( buffer );
346
347        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
348        return retValue;
349    }   //  immutableMultimap()
350
351    /**
352     *  Creates an immutable set from the given collection.
353     *
354     *  @param  <T> The type of the set elements.
355     *  @param  collection  The collection.
356     *  @return The immutable set.
357     *
358     *  @deprecated Use
359     *      {@link Set#copyOf(Collection)}
360     *      instead.
361     */
362    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
363    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
364    public static final <T> Set<T> immutableSet( final Collection<T> collection )
365    {
366        final var retValue = Set.copyOf( requireNonNullArgument( collection, "collection" ) );
367
368        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
369        return retValue;
370    }   //  immutableSet()
371
372    /**
373     *  Returns the Java String literal representing {@code value}, including
374     *  escaping double quotes.
375     *
376     *  @param  value   The input String.
377     *  @param  indent  The indentation String that has to be added in case of
378     *      a line break.
379     *  @return The Java literal.
380     */
381    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
382    public static String stringLiteralWithDoubleQuotes( final String value, final String indent )
383    {
384        final var retValue = new StringBuilder( value.length() + 2 );
385        retValue.append( '"' );
386        ScanLoop: for( var i = 0; i < value.length(); ++i )
387        {
388            final var c = value.charAt( i );
389
390            //---* The trivial case: single quote must not be escaped *--------
391            if( c == '\'' )
392            {
393                retValue.append( "'" );
394                continue ScanLoop;
395            }
396
397            //---* Another trivial case: double quotes must be escaped *-------
398            if( c == '"' )
399            {
400                retValue.append( '\\' ).append( '"' );
401                continue ScanLoop;
402            }
403
404            /*
405             * The default case: just let characterLiteralWithoutSingleQuotes()
406             * do its work.
407             */
408            retValue.append( characterLiteralWithoutSingleQuotes( c ) );
409
410            //---* Do we need to append indent after linefeed? *---------------
411            if( c == '\n' && i + 1 < value.length() )
412            {
413                /*
414                 * Originally, the indentation string was appended twice.
415                 */
416                retValue.append( "\"\n" ).append( indent ).append( "+ \"" );
417            }
418        }   //  ScanLoop:
419        retValue.append( '"' );
420
421        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
422        return retValue.toString();
423    }   //  stringLiteralWithDoubleQuotes()
424
425    /**
426     *  Checks whether the given
427     *  {@link Set}
428     *  of
429     *  {@link Modifier}
430     *  instances does contain one and only one of the {@code Modifier}
431     *  instances given with the second argument, {@code mutuallyExclusive}.
432     *
433     *  @param  modifiers   The set to check.
434     *  @param  mutuallyExclusive   A list of values from which one and only
435     *      one must be in the {@code modifiers} set.
436     *  @throws ValidationException None or more than one {@code Modifier}
437     *      instance was found.
438     */
439    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
440    public static final void requireExactlyOneOf( final Set<Modifier> modifiers, final Modifier... mutuallyExclusive ) throws ValidationException
441    {
442        requireNonNullArgument( modifiers, "modifiers" );
443        final var count = (int) Arrays.stream( requireNonNullArgument( mutuallyExclusive, "mutuallyExclusive" ) )
444            .filter( modifiers::contains )
445            .count();
446        checkArgument( count == 1, "modifiers %s must contain one of %s", modifiers, Arrays.toString( mutuallyExclusive ) );
447    }   //  requireExactlyOneOf()
448
449    /**
450     *  Creates a new set with the combined contents of the given sets.
451     *
452     *  @param  <T> The type of the set elements.
453     *  @param  a   The first set.
454     *  @param  b   The second set.
455     *  @return The combined set.
456     */
457    @SuppressWarnings( "TypeMayBeWeakened" )
458    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
459    public static final <T> Set<T> union( final Set<? extends T> a, final Set<? extends T> b )
460    {
461        final Set<T> retValue = new LinkedHashSet<>( a );
462        retValue.addAll( b );
463
464        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
465        return retValue;
466    }   //  union()
467}
468//  class Util
